Caption:
Stovetop Meatballsâœ¨ My favorite quick meatball recipe is ready in just about 30 minutes! We cook the meatballs right in the sauce so no messy clean up or multiple pans needed! These are perfect for those busy weeknights. I also sneak in some flax seed instead of breadcrumbs for added fiber ðŸ¤«

Hereâ€™s what you need:

Meatballs
1 lb ground beef (I use 80/20)
1 egg
1/2 white onion, finely diced (I used red onion here bc I ran out of white ðŸ« )
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp tomato paste
2 tsp italian seasoning
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
1/3 cup flax seed powder (sub breadcrumbs)
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon fresh black pepper

1 jar marinara sauce of choice
For serving: parsley or basil, parmesan cheese

Make the meatball mixture. Add all ingredients to a large bowl. Use your hands to combine until fully incorporated. Then use your hands to form into about 10 large meatballs. Place on parchment paper and set aside.

Pour the sauce into a large skillet and bring to a gentle simmer. Nestle the meatballs in the sauce, cover and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until cooked through. Remove the cover, flip the meatballs and give the sauce a stir to incorporate any separated fat. Let simmer uncovered for 2-3 more minutes to allow the sauce to thicken. 

Before serving, spoon the sauce over the meatballs, top with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan. Serve with fresh pasta or with a side salad!
